ca.uqac.lif.fs.net

Class FtpConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.fs.net.FtpConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystem

    public class FtpConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileSystem
    A file system giving access to resources over an FTP connection.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  FtpConnection.FtpInputStream
      An input stream reading a file from a remote connection, and taking care of completing the associated FTP command after it is closed.
      protected class  FtpConnection.FtpOutputStream
      An output stream writing a file on a remote connection, and taking care of completing the associated FTP command after it is closed.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ca.uqac.lif.fs.FileSystem

        FileSystem.OpenState

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected org.apache.commons.net.ftp.FTPClient m_client
      The FTPClient object used to handle the connection.
      protected org.apache.commons.net.ProtocolCommandListener m_commandListener
      An optional command listener used to watch the commands sent over the FTP connection.
      protected FilePath m_currentDir
      The path representing the current directory.
      protected java.util.Stack<FilePath> m_dirStack
      A stack containing the history of current directories.
      protected java.lang.String m_password
      The password used to log in.
      protected int m_port
      The TCP port on the server to connect to.
      protected java.lang.String m_server
      The name of the server to connect to.
      protected java.lang.String m_username
      The username used to log in.

          throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem

        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the interaction with the file system cannot be started

      • writeTo

        public java.io.OutputStream writeTo(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Writes data to a file. The method provides an OutputStream to which data can be printed. The data is guaranteed to be committed to the file only when the print stream is closed. Whether data is written before that moment depends on the actual file system implementation.
        Specified by:
        writeTo in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        An output stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason

      • readFrom

        public java.io.InputStream readFrom(java.lang.String filename)
                             throws FileSystemException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystem
        Reads data from a file. The method provides an InputStream from which data can be read. Consumers of this input stream have the responsibility to close the stream after usage.
        Specified by:
        readFrom in interface FileSystem
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to which data is to be written
        Returns:
        A print stream open on the file. If the method successfully returns, it guarantees that this stream is not null
        Throws:
        FileSystemException - Thrown if the operation could not be performed for some reason
